replies.body:
Well, the Fairy type was just introduced this generation. Remember in Gen 2 when Dark and Steel were introduced? There were like, 4 pokemon with Steel typing and 4 pokemon with Dark typing, and the Dark types weren't even that good. (except for Houndoom maybeh.) Or what about Dragon in Gen Wun, where it had 3 Pokemon (all in the same evolutionary line) only and the only dragon move was Dragon Rage (which btw did and still does only 40 HP.) I'm sure that Mega Sableye won't be as game-breaking as Mega Gengar (Shadow Tag OP) and Sableye's stats weren't that great to begin with anyways (whereas Mega Gengar had 110+ Speed and Special Attack.) We're not even taking into account that Sableye has a possibility of losing Prankster, an overall amazing (and trollish) ability that made regular Sableye at least somewhat viable in the game. And it loses its Leftovers too (in place of a Sableyenite... Sablenite? idk) which hurts its defensive niche and utility. Not to mention that Fairy types have already shaken up the game with their unique type matchups and decent lineup of Pokemon (Mega Mawile, Gardevoir, Klefki, etc.) unlike the previous Dark and Steel types.
But who knows, we don't know much about Mega Sableye so it might get some ridiculously OP stats or ability or something :T
